snippet: Home prices in most parts of the country appeared to bottom out in the summer of 2009 and to begin a slow recovery. But now they have fallen below 2009 levels in most markets, according to the Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller indexes released this...
lead_paragraph: Home prices in most parts of the country appeared to bottom out in the summer of 2009 and to begin a slow recovery. But now they have fallen below 2009 levels in most markets, according to the Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller indexes released this week. Markets where prices peaked in 2007, rather than earlier, generally seem to be suffering the most now.

keywords.value: Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index
keywords.name: subject
